articles.description: Reaction to Women's Euro 2025 qualifiers as England and Scotland win, and Manchester City's legal action against the Premier League, plus the latest news updates.
articles.title: Latest news plus reaction to Women's Euro 2025 qualifiers & Man City legal action

articles.description: Former Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte has been appointed the new boss of Napoli on a three-year deal.
articles.title: Antonio Conte: Napoli appoint former Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur manager

articles.description: England respond to Friday's defeat by France in fine style with the kind of performance in the return fixture that saw them win the Euros in 2022.
articles.title: England beat France in Euro 2025 qualifying and 'prove people wrong'

articles.description: Manchester City chairman Khaldoon al-Mubarak says the "constant referencing" of the 115 charges against the club are "frustrating".
articles.title: Man City: Premier League charges 'frustrating', says Khaldoon al-Mubarak

articles.description: With so many potential fights on the horizon, BBC Sport looks at what is next for the heavyweight division.
articles.title: Boxing: Deontay Wilder retirement, Anthony Joshua, Tyson Fury - what next for heavyweight division?

articles.description: Carlos Alcaraz makes light work of Stefanos Tsitsipas to set up a tantalising French Open semi-final against incoming world number one Jannik Sinner.
articles.title: French Open 2024: Carlos Alcaraz beats Stefanos Tsitsipas, Jannik Sinner sees off Grigor Dimitrov

articles.description: France forward Kylian Mbappe says "things and people made me unhappy" in his final year at Paris St-Germain.
articles.title: Kylian Mbappe: 'Things and people made me unhappy at PSG'

articles.description: Lily Yohannes, 16, made it a debut to remember as Emma Hayes' US side beat South Korea 3-0.
articles.title: Lily Yohannes, 16, scores on US debut as Emma Hayes' side beat South Korea

articles.description: Defending champion Novak Djokovic withdraws from the French Open with a knee injury before his quarter-final.
articles.title: Novak Djokovic injury: Defending champion withdraws from French Open

articles.description: It has been 58 years since England last won a major tournament - BBC Sport recaps some of the more painful exits and campaigns since 1966.
articles.title: England's 58 years of European Championship & World Cup pain
